titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Charles Gilbert Spross Papers, 1907-1982
titlestmt.author: Inventory prepared by Laura Streett

publicationstmt.publisher: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Laura Streett February 2011.

did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Charles Gilbert Spross Papers

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

did.abstract: Drafts of sheet music, scrapbooks, and biographical ephemera related to Charles Gilbert Spross's career as a pianist, accompanist, and composer.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Charles Gilbert Spross (1874-1961) was a pianist, accompanist, and composer. He was born in Poughkeepsie, New York, studied under Franz Xavier Scharwenke and Carl V. Lachmund, and traveled the world to accompany a number of opera singers, violinists, and other musicians.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Drafts of sheet music, scrapbooks, and biographical ephemera related to Charles Gilbert Spross's career as a pianist, accompanist, and composer.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research according to the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library without any additional restrictions.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to quote (publish) from unpublished or previously published material must be obtained as described in the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library.

odd.head: Encoding Information
odd.p: Encoded by Laura Streett, February 2011. Updated by Emma Gronbeck, February 2023.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Laura Streett, February 2011. Updated by Emma Gronbeck, February 2023.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The scrapbooks and most of the sheet music were a gift of R. Philip Hart, 2010 [M2011-011]. Additional material was transfered from the Vassar College Music Library in 2010 [M2010-011]. A gift of seven pieces of sheet music came from the New England Conservatory in 2015. Additional sheet music and ephemera were a gift of James F. Eilers, Jr. in 2023 [M2023-006].

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Charles Gilbert Spross Papers, Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries.
